title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("b-cubed-eu/b3gbi", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Tutorial
text: goal tutorial get familiar use b3gbi package, contains number functions calculating plotting biodiversity indicators GBIF occurrence cubes. package ready official release yet, publicly available https://www.github.com/b-cubed-eu/b3gbi. explain install package computer, give quick tutorial core functions, examples. Given package unfinished undergone limited testing, possible encounter errors. unable install package computer, can also clone github. Since b3gbi available github, need R package called devtools install .

title: Tutorial
code: install.packages("devtools") # unnecessary if you already have devtools devtools::install_github("b-cubed-eu/b3gbi")

title: Tutorial
text: Let’s look core functions b3gbi package. first one called process_cube() used import GBIF occurrence cubes .csv files R objects. simple use. need provide name location cube .csv format. Note different versions GBIF cubes floating around, format changed. Since code package created present generation came available, compatible old new cubes. old ones come additional .csv file containing taxonomic information cube. type name cube object, contents displayed custom print function within package. can see object structure using str(). cube contained tibble (tidyverse version data frame) called data, variables contain metadata. Now let’s look indicators available calculate plot. indicators registered ones actually working package. others, fully functional moment registered. available indicator listed along class, functions used calculate map /time series. next function need understand called compute_indicator_workflow(). core package, work calculating indicator done. indicator comes wrapper functions, used rather directly calling compute_indicator_workflow(). wrapper functions listed . type name indicator object, see plotted internal function package. cube objects, indicator objects contain tibble called data. case mapped indicator, tibble also sf object containing geometry information cell. indicator object belongs two specialized object classes determine handled use plot() command. First, either class ‘indicator_ts’ ‘indicator_map’. Second, class specific indicator type. can see using class() command. S3 classes (S3 one several objected oriented programming systems contained within R). final functions need interface plot functions. plot_ts() plot_map(), fact called using plot(). plot functions offer quite arguments customize output, plotting done using ggplot package, customization quite easy.   additional functions package can make use , list_species(), lists species contained cube indicator object, mostly quite simple. continued…

data cube in .csv format  #   * Argument 2 (only for older cubes): associated taxonomic info in .csv format # Outputs: #   * processed_cube object containing the data cube as output_object$data along total number of observations (num_obs),  #                                               vector of kingdoms (kingdoms),  #                                               number of families (num_families), #                                               resolutions (resolution)                                                   # Example: library(b3gbi) denmark_cube <- Mean Year of Occurrence #>      Class: newness #>      Calculate map: yes, e.g. newness_map(my_data_cube) #>      Calculate time series: yes, e.g. newness_ts(my_data_cube) #>      Additional map function arguments: NA #>      Additional time series function arguments: NA #>  #> 10. Taxonomic Distinctness #>      Class: tax_distinct #>      Calculate map: yes, e.g. tax_distinct_map(my_data_cube) #>      Calculate time series: yes, e.g. tax_distinct_ts(my_data_cube) #>      Additional map function arguments: NA #>      Additional time series function arguments: NA #>  #> 11. Species Richness (Estimated by Coverage-Based Rarefaction) #>      Class: hill0 #>      Calculate map: yes, e.g. hill0_map(my_data_cube) #>      Calculate time series: yes, e.g. hill0_ts(my_data_cube) #>      Additional map function arguments: cutoff_length, coverage #>      Additional time series function arguments: cutoff_length, coverage #>  #> 12. Hill-Shannon Diversity (Estimated by Coverage-Based Rarefaction) #>      Class: hill1 #>      Calculate map: yes, e.g. hill1_map(my_data_cube) #>      Calculate time series: yes, e.g. hill1_ts(my_data_cube) #>      Additional map function arguments: cutoff_length, coverage #>      Additional time series function arguments: cutoff_length, coverage #>  #> 13. Hill-Simpson Diversity (Estimated by Coverage-Based Rarefaction) #>      Class: hill2 #>      Calculate map: yes, e.g. hill2_map(my_data_cube) #>      Calculate time series: yes, e.g. hill2_ts(my_data_cube) #>      Additional map function arguments: cutoff_length, coverage #>      Additional time series function arguments: cutoff_length, coverage #>  #> 14. Species Occurrences #>      Class: spec_occ #>      Calculate map: yes, e.g. spec_occ_map(my_data_cube) #>      Calculate time series: yes, e.g. spec_occ_ts(my_data_cube) #>      Additional map function arguments: none #>      Additional time series function arguments: none #>  #> 15. Species Range #>      Class: spec_range #>      Calculate map: yes, e.g. spec_range_map(my_data_cube) #>      Calculate time series: yes, e.g. spec_range_ts(my_data_cube) #>      Additional map function arguments: none #>      Additional time series function arguments: none #>  #> 16. Occupancy Turnover #>      Class: occ_turnover #>      Calculate map: no #>      Calculate time series: yes, e.g. occ_turnover_ts(my_data_cube) #>      Additional map function arguments: none #>      Additional time series function arguments: none # Function 2: compute_indicator_workflow() # Description: Calculates a biodiversity indicator over time or space from a processed_cube object. Should be called by one of the wrapper functions listed below.  # Inputs:  #   * Argument 1: x, a processed_cube object #   * Argument 2: type, the type of indicator to calculate #   * Argument 3: dim_type, dimension to calculate the indicator across (time, 'ts', or space, 'map'). #   * Argument 4: cell_size (optional), the length (in km) of grid cells to use #   * Argument 5: level (optional), the scale of region to calculate over (country, continent, world). Uses the whole cube by default. #   * Argument 6: region (optional), the name of the region to calculate over (e.g. Germany, Europe). Uses the whole cube by default. #   * Argument 7: output_crs (optional), the projection to use for your calculated indicator if you don't want the default. #   * Argument 8: first_year (optional), use to limit the data used to calculate the indicator to a narrower range than the cube #   * Argument 9: last_year (optional), see first_year #   * Argument 10: spherical_geometry (optional), if FALSE, temporarily turn off spherical geometry when calculating indicator #   * Argument 11: make_valid (optional), call st_make_valid from the sf package to fix geometry issues if you are getting errors # Outputs: #   * indicator_ts or indicator_map object containing a data frame of indicator values mapped to years or grid cells, along with various metadata. #     metadata include: range of years (as first_year and last_year),  #                                               coordinate range (as xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax),  #                                               number of grid cells (num_cells),  #                                               number of species (num_species),  #                                               total number of observations (num_obs),  #                                               vector of kingdoms (kingdoms),  #                                               number of families (num_families), #                                               resolutions (resolution) # # Wrapper functions: #   * obs_richness_map(): Calculate a gridded map of observed richness #   * obs_richness_ts(): Calculate a time series (trend) of observed richness #   * cum_richness_ts(): Calculate cumulative richness over time #   * total_occ_map(): Calculate the total number of records over a gridded map #   * total_occ_ts(): Calculate the total number of records over time #   * occ_density_map(): Calculate the density of records over a gridded map #   * occ_density_ts(): Calculate the density of records over time #   * williams_eveness_map(): Calculate Williams' evenness over a gridded map #   * williams_evenness_ts(): Calculate Williams' evenness over time #   * pielou_evenness_map(): Calculate Pielou's evenness over a gridded map #   * pielou_evenness_ts(): Calculate Pielou's evenness over time #   * ab_rarity_map(): Calculate abundance-based rarity over a gridded map #   * ab_rarity_ts(): Calculate abundance-based rarity over time #   * area_rarity_map(): Calculate area-based rarity over a gridded map #   * area_rarity_ts(): Calculate area-based rarity over time #   * newness_map(): Calculate the mean year of occurrence over a gridded map #   * newness_ts(): Calculate the mean year of occurrence over time #                        # Example: library(b3gbi) Denmark_observed_richness_map <- obs_richness_map(example_cube_1, first_year = 1980, level = "country", region = "Denmark")  Denmark_observed_richness_map #> Gridded biodiversity indicator map #>  #> Name of Indicator: Observed Species Richness  #>  #> Map of Denmark  #>  #> Projected CRS: EPSG:4326  #>  #> Coordinate range: #>      xmin      ymin      xmax      ymax  #>  8.121484 54.628857 15.137109 57.736914  #>  #> Grid cell size: 0.25 km^2  #> Number of cells: 168  #>  #> Observation years: 1980 - 2023  #> Total years with observations: 44  #>  #> Number of species represented: 106  #> Number of families represented: 31  #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Animalia  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 168 × 3 #>    cellid area_km2 diversity_val #>     <int>   [km^2]         <int> #>  1     72     446.            32 #>  2     73     446.            34 #>  3     74     446.            47 #>  4     75     446.            48 #>  5     76     446.            37 #>  6     77     446.            21 #>  7     78     446.            33 #>  8     79     446.            32 #>  9     80     446.            29 #> 10     81     446.            41 #> # ℹ 158 more rows class(Denmark_observed_richness_map) #> [1] "indicator_map" "obs_richness" # Function 3: plot_ts() # Description: Plots an indicator_ts object as a time series using ggplot. Called by plot(). # Inputs:  #   * Argument 1: x, an indicator_ts object  #   * Argument 2: title (optional), specify a title for the plot #   * Argument 3: auto_title (optional), specified by the calling function if title is set to "auto" #   * Argument 4: y_label_default (optional), specified by the calling function if no y_label is provided #   * Argument 5: suppress_y (optional), default is "FALSE". Set to "TRUE" to turn off y axis text #   * Argument 6: smoothed_trend (optional), default is "TRUE". Set to "FALSE" to avoid displaying only the time series, without a smoothed trend  #   * Argument 7: linecolour (optional), sets the colour of the unsmoothed time series line #   * Argument 8: trendlinecolour (optional), sets the colour of the smoothed trend line  #   * Argument 9: envelopecolour (optional), sets the colour of smoothed trend envelope #   * Argument 10: gridoff (optional), default is "FALSE". Set to "TRUE" to turn off grid lines on the plot   #   * Argument 11: x_label (optional), use to set a custom label for the x-axis #   * Argument 12: y_label (optional), use to set a custom label for the y-axis #   * Argument 13: min_year (optional), set the first year that will be plotted #   * Argument 14: max_year (optional), set the final year that will be plotted #   * Argument 15: x_breaks (optional), set the number of breaks along the x-axis #   * Argument 16: y_breaks (optional), set the number of breaks along the y-axis #   * Argument 17: wrap_length (optional), set maximum length of text allowed on a single line for the plot title # Outputs: #   * Time series plot with optional smoothed trend overlay. The plot can be further customized (beyond the provided arguments) using ggplot functions. #   * Plots can be saved using ggsave.  # Example: library(b3gbi) Denmark_observed_richness_ts <- obs_richness_ts(example_cube_1, first_year = 1980, level = "country", region = "Denmark")  plot(Denmark_observed_richness_ts) # Function 4: plot_map() # Description: Plots an indicator_map object as a gridded map using ggplot. Called by plot(). # Inputs:  #   * Argument 1: x, an indicator_map object  #   * Argument 2: title (optional), specify a title for the plot #   * Argument 3: auto_title (optional), specified by the calling function if title is set to "auto" #   * Argument 4: leg_label_default (optional), legend title specified by the calling function if no leg_label is provided #   * Argument 5: xlims (optional), use to set custom map limits #   * Argument 6: ylims (optional), use to set custom map limits  #   * Argument 7: trans (optional), set transformation to apply to the legend, e.g. "log10" #   * Argument 8: breaks (optional), set custom breaks for the legend #   * Argument 9: labels (optional), set custom labels for the legend #   * Argument 10: Europe_crop (optional), default is "TRUE". Crops outlying islands when plotting a continental map of Europe. You can set this to "FALSE" to show the islands, but the output will be less pretty.   #   * Argument 11: surround (optional), default is "TRUE". Shows surrounding countries when plotting a single country. Set to "FALSE" to show only the country of interest, but output will be less pretty. #   * Argument 12: panel_gb (optional), set panel background colour. Default is "white". #   * Argument 13: legend_title (optional), set a custom legend title #   * Argument 14: legend_limits (optional), set custom limits for the legend #   * Argument 15: legend_title_wrap_length (optional), set maximum length of text allowed on a single line for the legend title #   * Argument 16: title_wrap_length (optional), set maximum length of text allowed on a single line for the plot title # Outputs: #   * Time series plot with optional smoothed trend overlay. The plot can be further customized (beyond the provided arguments) using ggplot functions. #   * Plots can be saved using ggsave.  # Example: library(b3gbi) Denmark_observed_richness_map <- obs_richness_map(example_cube_1, level = "country", region = "Denmark")  plot(Denmark_observed_richness_map)

title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: Biodiversity researchers need robust standardized tools analyze vast amounts data available platforms like GBIF. b3gbi package leverages power data cubes streamline biodiversity assessments. helps researchers gain insights : Changes Time: biodiversity metrics shift throughout years. Spatial Variations: Differences biodiversity across regions, identifying hotspots areas concern. Impact Factors: different environmental variables human activities might affect biodiversity patterns.

title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: b3gbi empowers biodiversity analysis : Standardized Workflows: Simplify process calculating common biodiversity indicators GBIF data cubes. Flexibility: Calculate richness, evenness, rarity, taxonomic distinctness, Shannon-Hill diversity, Simpson-Hill diversity, . Analysis Options: Explore temporal trends create spatial maps. Visualization Tools: Generate publication-ready plots biodiversity metrics.

code: # Load package library(b3gbi)  # Load GBIF data cube cube_name <- system.file("extdata", "denmark_mammals_cube_eqdgc.csv", package = "b3gbi")  # Prepare cube mammal_data <- process_cube(cube_name)  # Calculate diversity metric map_obs_rich_mammals <- obs_richness_map(mammal_data, level = "country", region = "Denmark")  # Plot diversity metric plot(map_obs_rich_mammals, title = "Observed Species Richness: Mammals in Denmark")

what: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
text: function provides flexible framework calculating various biodiversity indicators spatial grid time series. prepares data, creates grid, calculates indicators, formats output appropriate S3 object ('indicator_map' 'indicator_ts').

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
code: compute_indicator_workflow(   data,   type,   dim_type = c("map", "ts"),   cell_size = NULL,   level = c("continent", "country", "world"),   region = "Europe",   output_crs = NULL,   first_year = NULL,   last_year = NULL,   spherical_geometry = TRUE,   make_valid = FALSE,   ... )

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
text: data data cube object (class 'processed_cube'). type indicator calculate. Supported options include: 'obs_richness': Observed species richness. 'total_occ': Total number occurrences. 'newness': Mean year occurrence. 'density': Density occurrences. 'williams_evenness', 'pielou_evenness': Evenness measures. 'ab_rarity', 'area_rarity':  Abundance-based area-based rarity scores. dim_type Dimension calculate indicator (time: 'ts', space: 'map') cell_size Length grid cell sides, km. (Default: 10 country, 100 continent world) level Spatial level: 'continent', 'country', 'world'. (Default: 'continent') region region interest (e.g., "Europe"). (Default: "Europe") output_crs CRS want calculated indicator. (Leave blank let function choose default based grid reference system) first_year Exclude data year. (Uses data cube default.) last_year Exclude data year. (Uses data cube default.) spherical_geometry set FALSE, temporarily disable spherical geometry function runs. used solve specific issues. (Default TRUE) make_valid Calls st_make_valid() sf package. Increases processing time may help getting polygon errors. (Default FALSE). ... Additional arguments passed specific indicator calculation functions.

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
text: S3 object containing calculated indicator values metadata.

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
code: diversity_map <- compute_indicator_workflow(example_cube_1,                                             type = "obs_richness",                                             dim_type = "map",                                             level = "country",                                             region = "Denmark") diversity_map #> Gridded biodiversity indicator map #>  #> Name of Indicator: Observed Species Richness  #>  #> Map of Denmark  #>  #> Projected CRS: EPSG:4326  #>  #> Coordinate range: #>      xmin      ymin      xmax      ymax  #>  8.121484 54.628857 15.137109 57.736914  #>  #> Grid cell size: 0.25 km^2  #> Number of cells: 168  #>  #> Observation years: 1862 - 2023  #> Total years with observations: 125  #>  #> Number of species represented: 106  #> Number of families represented: 31  #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Animalia  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 168 × 3 #>    cellid area_km2 diversity_val #>     <int>   [km^2]         <int> #>  1     72     446.            32 #>  2     73     446.            34 #>  3     74     446.            47 #>  4     75     446.            48 #>  5     76     446.            37 #>  6     77     446.            21 #>  7     78     446.            33 #>  8     79     446.            32 #>  9     80     446.            29 #> 10     81     446.            41 #> # ℹ 158 more rows

text: Processes GBIF data cube (applicable) associated taxonomic information file. cube includes taxonomic info file likely previous generation cube processed using 'process_cube_old'. taxonomic info file must reside directory cube share base file name (e.g., 'cubes/my_mammals_cube.csv', 'cubes/my_mammals_info.csv'). cube include taxonomic info file likely current generation cube processed using standard process_cube function API used generate current generation cubes flexible allows user-specified column names. Therefore, please check column names cube match Darwin Core standard expected process_cube function. , may need enter manually. function return error find required columns.

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
code: process_cube(   cube_name,   grid_type = c("automatic", "eea", "mgrs", "eqdgc", "custom", "none"),   first_year = NULL,   last_year = NULL,   force_gridcode = FALSE,   cols_year = NULL,   cols_yearMonth = NULL,   cols_cellCode = NULL,   cols_occurrences = NULL,   cols_scientificName = NULL,   cols_minCoordinateUncertaintyInMeters = NULL,   cols_minTemporalUncertainty = NULL,   cols_kingdom = NULL,   cols_family = NULL,   cols_species = NULL,   cols_kingdomKey = NULL,   cols_familyKey = NULL,   cols_speciesKey = NULL,   cols_familyCount = NULL,   cols_sex = NULL,   cols_lifeStage = NULL )  process_cube_old(   cube_name,   tax_info = NULL,   datasets_info = NULL,   first_year = 1600,   last_year = NULL )

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
text: cube_name location name data cube file (e.g., 'inst/extdata/europe_species_cube.csv'). grid_type Specify grid reference system cube uses. default function attempt determine automatically return error fails. want perform analysis cube custom grid codes (e.g. output gcube package) cube without grid codes, select 'custom' 'none', respectively. first_year (Optional) first year occurrences include. specified, uses default 1600 prevent false records (e.g. year = 0). last_year (Optional) final year occurrences include. specified, uses latest year present cube. force_gridcode Force function assume specific grid reference system. may cause unexpected downstream issues, recommended. getting errors related grid cell codes, check make sure valid. cols_year name column containing year occurrence (something 'year'). column required unless yearMonth column. cols_yearMonth name column containing year month occurrence (present 'yearMonth'). Use year column. b3gbi package use month data, function convert yearMonth column year column. cols_cellCode name column containing grid reference codes ('cellCode'). column required. cols_occurrences name column containing number occurrence ('occurrences'). column required. cols_scientificName name column containing scientific name species ('scientificName'). Note necessary species column scientificName column. One sufficient. cols_minCoordinateUncertaintyInMeters name column containing minimum coordinate uncertainty occurrences ('minCoordinateUncertaintyinMeters'). cols_minTemporalUncertainty name column containing minimum temporal uncertainty occurrences ('minTemporalUncertainty'). cols_kingdom name column containing kingdom occurring species belongs ('kingdom'). column optional. cols_family name column containing family occurring species belongs ('family'). column optional. cols_species name column containing name occurring species ('species'). Note necessary species column scientificName column. One sufficient. cols_kingdomKey name column containing kingdom key occurring species ('kingdomKey'). column optinal. cols_familyKey name column containing family key occurring species ('familykey'). column optional. cols_speciesKey name column containing species key occurring species ('speciesKey'). column required, note 'taxonKey' column can provide speciesKey. cols_familyCount name column containing occurrence count family. column optional. cols_sex name column containing sex observed individuals. column optional. cols_lifeStage name column containing life stage observed individuals. column optional. tax_info location name associated taxonomic info file (e.g.,  'inst/extdata/europe_species_info.csv'). datasets_info location name associated dataset info file (e.g., 'inst/extdata/europe_species_datasets.csv').

Calculate Range Size (Number of Cells Occupied) for One or More Species Over Time — spec_range_ts
text: data data cube object (class 'processed_cube'). ... Arguments passed compute_indicator_workflow cell_size Length grid cell sides, km. (Default: 10 country, 100 continent world) level Spatial level: 'continent', 'country', 'world'. (Default: 'continent') region region interest (e.g., "Europe"). (Default: "Europe") output_crs CRS want calculated indicator. (Leave blank let function choose default based grid reference system) first_year Exclude data year. (Uses data cube default.) last_year Exclude data year. (Uses data cube default.) spherical_geometry set FALSE, temporarily disable spherical geometry function runs. used solve specific issues. (Default TRUE) make_valid Calls st_make_valid() sf package. Increases processing time may help getting polygon errors. (Default FALSE).

title: Calculate Taxonomic Distinctness Over Space — tax_distinct_map
Calculate Taxonomic Distinctness Over Space — tax_distinct_map
text: data data cube object (class 'processed_cube'). rows Choose row select multiple matches retrieving taxonomic information GBIF. (Default 1. Use NA interactive mode.) ... Arguments passed compute_indicator_workflow cell_size Length grid cell sides, km. (Default: 10 country, 100 continent world) level Spatial level: 'continent', 'country', 'world'. (Default: 'continent') region region interest (e.g., "Europe"). (Default: "Europe") output_crs CRS want calculated indicator. (Leave blank let function choose default based grid reference system) first_year Exclude data year. (Uses data cube default.) last_year Exclude data year. (Uses data cube default.) spherical_geometry set FALSE, temporarily disable spherical geometry function runs. used solve specific issues. (Default TRUE) make_valid Calls st_make_valid() sf package. Increases processing time may help getting polygon errors. (Default FALSE).

what: Calculate Taxonomic Distinctness Over Time — tax_distinct_ts
title: Calculate Taxonomic Distinctness Over Time — tax_distinct_ts
text: function calculates taxonomic distinctness index time series.

title: Calculate Taxonomic Distinctness Over Time — tax_distinct_ts
Calculate Taxonomic Distinctness Over Time — tax_distinct_ts
text: data data cube object (class 'processed_cube'). rows Choose row select multiple matches retrieving taxonomic information GBIF. (Default 1. Use NA interactive mode.) ... Arguments passed compute_indicator_workflow cell_size Length grid cell sides, km. (Default: 10 country, 100 continent world) level Spatial level: 'continent', 'country', 'world'. (Default: 'continent') region region interest (e.g., "Europe"). (Default: "Europe") output_crs CRS want calculated indicator. (Leave blank let function choose default based grid reference system) first_year Exclude data year. (Uses data cube default.) last_year Exclude data year. (Uses data cube default.) spherical_geometry set FALSE, temporarily disable spherical geometry function runs. used solve specific issues. (Default TRUE) make_valid Calls st_make_valid() sf package. Increases processing time may help getting polygon errors. (Default FALSE).

b3gbi 0.2.1
text: 27.06.2024 - Minor update: Added options improve control plot output. argument land_fill_colour allows change colour land area outside grid.argument crop_to_grid snap plot edges gridded area. improve way plot looks e.g. data sparse extend edges country continent. Fixed bug process_cube_old caused fail. Fixed bug caused calculated indicator objects retain many data columns.

title: b3gbi 0.2.0
text: 24.06.2024 - Major update: Added occupancy turnover available indicators. indicators package now working (can get list typing ‘available_indicators’). process_cube function now expects current generation cube (created using GBIF API) default. Previous generation cubes (created using TriAS project code) can still used must now processed using separate function, process_cube_old. Added support non-standard column names (can manually input column names processing cube, process_cube function rename Darwin Core standard expected rest package). Added support Quarter Degree Military grids (note Military grids translated external package CRAN. hoped replace native code later update). Process_cube function can now automatically find column containing grid cell codes detect type grid (options manually input column name grid cell type cases better leave automatic avoid potential downstream problems). can now select output CRS want use calculated indicator.
